name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Sleeps, Moraiat, profbobo, kingsleymc, dracer2)

text: His look in the last panel is priceless.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: 6 hundo.....million?

name: nessotron
text: It is always nice to hear. Always.

name: audhumla
text: Ray often hears that his early photographic erotica is absolutely fabulous

name: qatipay
text: But he never appreciates it any less.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Ray speaks straight into the microphone and looks at the audience.

name: aperson
text: It certainly would be worth more to certain.

name: sp1derbaby
text: ..members of parliament.

name: jdhenry105
text: I would like to hear Dr. Manflesh's take on this cartoon.

name: tekende
text: If I find some Sonic the Hedgehog slash fiction and post it here, will that be good enough?

name: baryonyx
text: This begs the question, how many pages of Sonic the Hedgehog erotic fanfiction have been written throughout history? And from that grand total is there a percentage of them that might be deemed worth reading by a sane man?

name: tekende
text: I do not know. I'd imagine there's a lot of it, though. I'd also imagine most of it isn't worth reading.

name: stereo
text: A comment left by stereo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by TonyHighwind, goro, MajesticTrout, NotCool)

text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAH

text: When Manflesh just isn't quick enough.

name: carlyle
text:

Sorry buddy.

name: belgand
text:
Ah, but what would the value be of the first Sonic erotic slash fanfic story ever written? What about the first known piece of erotic furry art?

This stuff will be priceless for historical reasons in the future. It is almost already worth something now.

name: professoryes
text: "Next up on Antiques' Roadshow: A random man will be on drugs, beheaded, and stabbed in the arm when his Baroque harpsichord ends up being a twenties jazz reproduction made from very weak wood. Stay tuned."

name: epicurus
text: The antiques roadshow guy knows when to interrupt a dude.

name: saint
text: i've always wondered why the roadshow guys don't just walk up, be all like "600 million" and walk away. that would make the show move along a lot faster.

name: tekende
text: Same reason contestants on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire don't just straight-up answer the questions.

name: joestork
text: 600 million dollars. Jesus, I mean, that's a lot a of dang fucking money.

name: thrasher
text: I am feeling the TV viewer's guilty pleasure, the Antique Roadshow "dumb luck jackpot", multiplied by a contestant who we actually care about and more money than is really possible.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Roast Beef: p.a.

name: mc_white
text: This strip is so... IMPORTANT.  This totally makes Ray who we know him to be in later strips. The richiest fuckin cat in the WORLD!

name: woodenteeth
text: I always thought it was because he was the best piano player in the world due to selling his soul to Beelzebub. Record contract and all.

name: tonyhighwind
text: [i]Doggs, it was totally both![/i}

name: tonyhighwind
text: Ugliest, code, guitar.

name: scion
text: How soon after one mentions Antiques Roadshow does that bespectacled host invade one's home to critique one's attic-jumble?
